info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 30 at 6:45PM MDT until July 30 at 7:15PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... East central Mora County in northeastern New Mexico... * Until 715 PM MDT. * At 644 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Wagon Mound, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. Hail may accumulate on Interstate 25. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Wagon Mound. This includes Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 381 and 391. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Heavy rains from severe thunderstorms can produce sudden and dangerous flows in arroyos, ditches and over low water crossings. Do not attempt to drive through areas where water covers the roadway.
